SEARCH
Module fi.tuni.progthree.weatherapp
Package fi.tuni.prog3.weatherapp

Interface iAPI

All Known Implementing Classes:
iAPI.OpenWeatherMapAPI
public interface iAPI
Defines methods for interacting with an external weather API. These methods provide functionality for retrieving location information and weather data based on coordinates.
Author:
Patrik Salmensaari, Tommi Paavola

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getCurrentWeather(double lat, double lon)
    Fetches the current weather data for the given coordinates and saves the response as a formatted JSON file.
    String
    getForecast(double lat, double lon)
    Fetches a weather forecast for the given coordinates and saves the response as a formatted JSON file.

    Returns coordinates for a location.

  • Method Details

    • lookUpLocationCoordinates

      ArrayList<Double> lookUpLocationCoordinates(String loc)
      Returns coordinates for a location. Fetches coordinates based on municipality name from file municipalityCoordinates.json
      Parameters:
      loc - Name of the location for which coordinates should be fetched. (Case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Double. first element is longitude, second latitude. Returns {0.0 , 0.0} if place not found.

    • lookUpLocationName

      String lookUpLocationName(double lat, double lon)
      Gives a location name based on its coordinates. Searches the match from the json File municipalityCoordinates.json. Considered a match if the coordinates values until 5th decimal match.
      Parameters:
      lat - Latitude as Double
      lon - Longitude as Double
      Returns:
      Name of location as String. If not found, returns the string "Not found".

    • getCurrentWeather

      String getCurrentWeather(double lat, double lon)
      Fetches the current weather data for the given coordinates and saves the response as a formatted JSON file.
      Parameters:
      lat - The latitude of the location.
      lon - The longitude of the location.
      Returns:
      The file name of the saved JSON file containing the current weather data. If an error occurs, returns null.

    • getForecast

      String getForecast(double lat, double lon)
      Fetches a weather forecast for the given coordinates and saves the response as a formatted JSON file.
      Parameters:
      lat - The latitude of the location.
      lon - The longitude of the location.
      Returns:
      The file name of the saved JSON file containing the forecast data. If an error occurs, returns null.
